alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon; East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades; Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; John Day Basin; North Central Oregon; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 28 at 2:54PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS EXPECTED DUE TO SNOWMELT... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will see rises into next week. High pressure building over the Pacific Northwest has led to an increase in temperatures, with the trend continuing Saturday and after a brief cooling period, more warming expected next week. Given above normal snowpack currently in place over the mountains, accelerating snowmelt is expected to lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to get close to or meet bankfull over the weekend into early next week. The Naches at Naches and at Cliffdell have already risen above bankfull but are not expected to reach minor flood stage. A few gauges may briefly cross into minor flood stage next week, but widespread flooding is currently not anticipated. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Saturday afternoon with any pertinent updates concerning the latest flood forecast.
